title: MRC Viewability
description: Browser or app settings measured at runtime describing the viewability of an advertisement associated with each page load.

adUnitDepth.title: Ad Unit Depth
adUnitDepth.description: Publishers may embed ad units inside containers/iFrames in order limit the ad's access solely to the code of the page. This describes how many 'containers' or iFrames the ad unit is displayed inside of.

viewportHeight.title: Viewport Height
viewportHeight.description: The vertical size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside measured at runtime. For a web view event, the browser viewport height.

viewportWidth.title: Viewport Width
viewportWidth.description: The horizontal size (in pixels) of the window the experience was displayed inside measured at runtime. For a web view event, the browser viewport width.

adHeight.title: Ad Height
adHeight.description: The number of vertical pixels of the player, measured at runtime. This can be larger than the size of the ad if the player has extra controls or thumbnails.

adWidth.title: Ad Width
adWidth.description: The number of horizontal pixels of the player, measured at runtime. This can be larger than the size of the ad if the player has extra controls or thumbnails.

playerVolume.title: Player Volume Percentage
playerVolume.description: The player volume percentage, measured at runtime where 0 is muted and 100 is maximum volume.

measurementEligible.title: Viewability Measurement Eligible
measurementEligible.description: Whether or not the ad was eligible to viewability measurement. An ad is eligible if the unit has a supported creative format and tag type.

implementationDetails.title: Viewabiltity Implementation Details
implementationDetails.description: The name and version of the library instrumented to measure viewability metrics.

viewable.title: Viewable Ad
viewable.description: Display ads are considered viewable when at least 50% of the ad is visible for at least 1 second. Video ads are considered viewable when at least 50% of the ad is visible while the video is playing for at least 2 consecutive seconds. All viewable ads are measurable, because you can't confirm that an ad has met the criteria for viewability unless it can be measured.

activeWindow.title: Active Window
activeWindow.description: Indicates whether ad was shown on active window on users' device.

percentViewable.title: Percent Viewable
percentViewable.description: Percent of pixels in the ad deemed viewable at measurement time.

viewabilityEligibleImpressions.description: Impression(s) of an advertisement to an end-user with viewablility library instrumented.

measuredAdNotVisible.description: Indicator of ad not being visible as measured by a viewability library at impression time.

measuredMuted.description: Indicator of ad being muted as measured by a viewability library at impression time.

measuredWindowInactive.description: Indicator of ad being displayed in an inactive window as measured by a viewability library at impression time.

unmeasurableIframe.description: Indicator of viewability library not being able to properly execute measurements due to ad being displayed inside an iframe.

unmeasurableOther.description: Indicator of viewability library not being able to properly execute measurements due to non-predefined error.

viewableCompletes.description: Completion(s) of an advertisement to an end-user deemed viewable at completion time by a viewability library.

viewableFirstQuartiles.description: First quartile(s) of an advertisement to an end-user deemed viewable at first quartile of play by a viewability library.

viewableImpressions.description: Impressions of an advertisement to an end-user deemed viewable after two seconds of play by a viewability library.

viewableMidpoints.description: Midpoint(s) of an advertisement to an end-user deemed viewable at midpoint of play by a viewability library.

viewableThirdQuartiles.description: Third quartile(s) of an advertisement to an end-user deemed viewable at third quartile of play by a viewability library.
